intro: Canthium impressinervium, commonly known as the narrow-veined spurge, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves with prominent venation patterns. Its small, inconspicuous flowers are typically clustered in cyathia, a unique structure typical of the Euphorbiaceae family. The plant is often found in moist, shaded habitats and is adapted to thrive in humid environments.
